title: Copa de Oro Argentina
text:
The Copa de Oro Argentina was a Spanish <a href="association%20football">football</a> competition, held once on 23 December 1945 as a one-off game between <a href="FC%20Barcelona">FC Barcelona</a> (winner of the <a href="1944%E2%80%9345%20La%20Liga">1944–45 La Liga</a>) and <a href="Athletic%20Bilbao">Athletic Bilbao</a> (winner of the <a href="1944%E2%80%9345%20Copa%20del%20General%C3%ADsimo">1944–45 Copa del Generalísimo</a>), with Barcelona winning 5–4 at their <a href="Camp%20de%20Les%20Corts">Camp de Les Corts</a> stadium.
The match was organised by the <a href="Catalan%20Football%20Federation">Catalan Football Federation</a> on the initiative of the Argentine consulate in Barcelona, with the trophy being provided by the city's Argentine community.
It was the second <a href="super%20cup">super cup</a> in Spanish football, after the one-off <a href="Copa%20de%20los%20Campeones%20de%20Espa%C3%B1a">Copa de los Campeones de España</a> in 1940. In 1947, the first official tournament was played, the <a href="Copa%20Eva%20Duarte">Copa Eva Duarte</a> which ran to 1953. The current <a href="Supercopa%20de%20Espa%C3%B1a">Supercopa de España</a> began in 1982.
